name: Vanilla Bean Cupcakes
description: Light and fluffy cupcakes infused with vanilla bean.
instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F. Cream butter and sugar...
2. Add eggs and vanilla bean...
3. Mix in dry ingredients alternately with milk...
4. Divide batter into cupcake liners and bake for 20 minutes.

name: Chocolate Cupcakes
description: Rich and moist chocolate cupcakes with a creamy chocolate frosting.
instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F. Mix flour, cocoa powder, baking soda, and salt...
2. In another bowl, beat eggs, sugar, oil, and vanilla...
3. Combine with dry ingredients and add milk...
4. Pour into cupcake liners and bake for 20-25 minutes.

name: Red Velvet Cupcakes
description: Velvety cupcakes with a hint of cocoa and a vibrant red color, topped with cream cheese frosting.
instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F. Mix flour, cocoa powder, and baking soda...
2. In another bowl, combine eggs, sugar, oil, vinegar, vanilla, and food coloring...
3. Gradually add dry ingredients to wet mixture alternating with buttermilk...
4. Fill cupcake liners and bake for 20 minutes.

name: Lemon Cupcakes
description: Light cupcakes with a fresh lemon flavor and lemon buttercream frosting.
instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F. Cream butter and sugar...
2. Add eggs one at a time, then lemon zest and juice...
3. Combine flour, baking powder, and salt; add to wet mixture alternately with milk...
4. Fill cupcake liners and bake for 18-22 minutes.

name: Strawberry Cupcakes
description: Moist cupcakes made with fresh strawberries, perfect for summer.
instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F. Cream butter and sugar...
2. Add eggs and vanilla...
3. Mix in flour, baking powder, and salt...
4. Stir in strawberries and milk...
5. Spoon into cupcake liners and bake for 22-25 minutes.

name: Classic Chocolate Cake
description: A rich and moist chocolate cake with a smooth chocolate frosting.
instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F. Mix dry ingredients...
2. Add eggs, milk, oil, and vanilla. Stir in boiling water...
3. Pour into pans and bake for 30-35 minutes...
4. Cool and frost with chocolate frosting.

name: Vanilla Sponge Cake
description: A light and airy vanilla sponge cake, perfect for layering with fruit and cream.
instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F. Cream butter and sugar...
2. Add eggs one at a time. Stir in vanilla...
3. Mix in flour and baking powder alternately with milk...
4. Pour into pans and bake for 25-30 minutes.

name: Carrot Cake
description: A moist and spiced carrot cake with a creamy cream cheese frosting.
instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F. Mix flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, salt, and cinnamon...
2. Add eggs and oil. Stir in carrots and walnuts...
3. Pour into pans and bake for 40-45 minutes...
4. Cool and frost with cream cheese frosting.

name: Lemon Drizzle Cake
description: A tangy and moist lemon cake with a sweet lemon glaze.
instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F. Cream butter and sugar...
2. Add eggs. Mix in lemon zest and juice...
3. Combine flour, baking powder, and salt. Add to wet mixture...
4. Bake for 30-35 minutes. Mix lemon juice and sugar for drizzle and pour over warm cake.

name: Red Velvet Cake
description: A classic red velvet cake with a rich cream cheese frosting.
instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F. Mix flour, sugar, baking soda, cocoa, and salt...
2. Add eggs, oil, buttermilk, food coloring, vinegar, and vanilla...
3. Pour into pans and bake for 30-35 minutes...
4. Cool and apply cream cheese frosting.

name: Coconut Cake
description: A fluffy and moist coconut cake with a creamy coconut frosting.
instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F. Cream butter and sugar...
2. Add eggs one at a time. Mix in vanilla...
3. Combine flour, baking powder, and salt. Add to wet mixture alternately with coconut milk...
4. Stir in shredded coconut. Bake for 30-35 minutes. Frost with coconut frosting.

name: Classic Sourdough Bread
description: Artisanal sourdough bread with a tangy flavor and a crisp crust.
instructions:
1. Mix all ingredients to form a sticky dough...
2. Let it rise for 12-14 hours...
3. Shape the dough and let it rise for another 2 hours...
4. Bake in a preheated oven at 450°F for 30-35 minutes.

name: Whole Wheat Bread
description: Healthy and hearty whole wheat bread, perfect for sandwiches.
instructions:
1. Dissolve yeast in warm water with honey...
2. Mix in flours and salt to form a dough...
3. Knead until smooth. Let it rise for 1 hour...
4. Shape the loaf and let it rise for another 30 minutes before baking at 375°F for 25-30 minutes.

name: French Baguette
description: Classic French baguette with a crispy crust and chewy interior.
instructions:
1. Combine all ingredients to form a dough...
2. Knead for 5-10 minutes. Let it rise for 1 hour...
3. Divide and shape into baguettes. Let them rise for 45 minutes...
4. Bake at 475°F for 25 minutes with steam.

name: Multigrain Bread
description: Nutritious bread packed with a variety of grains and seeds.
instructions:
1. Dissolve yeast in warm water with honey...
2. Mix in flours, seeds, and salt...
3. Knead until smooth. Let it rise for 1 hour...
4. Shape the loaf and let it rise for 30 minutes. Bake at 375°F for 30-35 minutes.

name: Classic Chocolate Chip Cookies
description: Crunchy on the outside, chewy on the inside, loaded with chocolate chips.
ingredients: 2 cups semisweet and/or milk chocolate chips
instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F. Mix flour and baking soda...
2. Cream butter and sugars until smooth. Add salt, vanilla, and eggs...
3. Mix in flour mixture. Stir in chocolate chips...
4. Drop spoonfuls onto baking sheets and bake for 8-10 minutes.

name: Peanut Butter Cookies
description: Soft and chewy peanut butter cookies, a classic favorite.
instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F. Mix flour, baking soda, and salt...
2. Cream butter, peanut butter, and sugars. Add eggs and vanilla...
3. Gradually mix in flour mixture...
4. Roll into balls, press with a fork, and bake for 10-12 minutes.

name: Oatmeal Raisin Cookies
description: Chewy cookies loaded with oats and raisins, a wholesome treat.
instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F. Mix flour, baking soda, and salt...
2. Cream butter and sugars. Add eggs and vanilla...
3. Stir in oats and raisins. Gradually add flour mixture...
4. Drop spoonfuls onto baking sheets and bake for 10-12 minutes.

name: White Chocolate Macadamia Nut Cookies
description: Luxurious cookies with creamy white chocolate and crunchy macadamia nuts.
instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F. Mix flour and baking soda...
2. Cream butter and sugars. Add salt, vanilla, and eggs...
3. Stir in flour mixture, white chocolate chips, and macadamia nuts...
4. Drop onto baking sheets and bake for 10-12 minutes.

name: Snickerdoodle Cookies
description: Soft cookies coated with cinnamon sugar, with a delightful chewy texture.
instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F. Mix flour, baking powder, and salt...
2. Cream butter and 1 1/2 cups sugar. Add eggs...
3. Gradually mix in flour mixture...
4. Shape into balls, roll in cinnamon sugar, and bake for 8-10 minutes.

name: Butter Croissants
description: Flaky and buttery croissants, perfect for a luxurious breakfast.
ingredients: 1 cup unsalted butter, cold and sliced
instructions:
1. Combine flour, sugar, salt, and yeast. Add milk and egg...
2. Knead until smooth. Refrigerate for 1 hour...
3. Roll dough and place butter slices on top. Fold and roll several times...
4. Cut into triangles and roll into croissants. Let rise for 1 hour...
5. Bake at 400°F for 15-20 minutes.

name: Apple Danish
description: Sweet and fruity danishes with a rich apple filling and icing drizzle.
instructions:
1. Mix flour, sugar, salt, and yeast. Add milk, water, and egg...
2. Knead to form a smooth dough. Let it rise for 1 hour...
3. Roll dough, spread butter, fold, and chill for 30 minutes. Repeat twice...
4. Cut into squares, add apple filling, and shape. Let rise for 30 minutes...
5. Bake at 375°F for 20-25 minutes. Drizzle with icing.

name: Chocolate Eclairs
description: Elegant eclairs filled with creamy custard and topped with chocolate glaze.
instructions:
1. Boil water and butter. Add flour and salt. Stir vigorously...
2. Cook until the dough forms a ball. Cool slightly and add eggs one at a time...
3. Pipe dough into long shapes. Bake at 425°F for 15 minutes, then 350°F for 20 minutes...
4. Fill with pastry cream and top with chocolate glaze.

name: Classic Glazed Doughnuts
description: Soft and fluffy doughnuts with a sweet vanilla glaze.
instructions:
1. Combine flour, sugar, salt, and yeast. Add warm milk, butter, and egg. Knead...
2. Let dough rise for 1 hour...
3. Roll out, cut into doughnut shapes, and let rise for 30 minutes...
4. Fry in hot oil until golden. Mix powdered sugar, milk, and vanilla for glaze. Dip doughnuts into glaze.

name: Chocolate Doughnuts
description: Rich chocolate doughnuts with a chocolate glaze and sprinkles.
instructions:
1. Mix flour, cocoa powder, sugar, yeast, and salt. Add milk, butter, and egg. Knead...
2. Let dough rise for 1 hour...
3. Cut into doughnut shapes, let rise for 30 minutes...
4. Fry until golden. For glaze, combine powdered sugar, cocoa powder, and milk. Dip doughnuts and add sprinkles.

name: Cinnamon Sugar Doughnuts
description: Warm and sugary doughnuts coated in cinnamon sugar, a perfect treat.
instructions:
1. Combine flour, sugar, baking powder, salt, cinnamon, and nutmeg. Mix in milk, butter, and egg...
2. Roll out, cut into doughnut shapes...
3. Fry in hot oil until golden. Mix sugar and cinnamon for coating. Coat warm doughnuts.

name: Vegan Chocolate Chip Cookies
description: Crispy on the edges and chewy in the middle, these vegan cookies are a delight.
instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F. Mix flour, baking soda, and salt...
2. In another bowl, combine coconut oil, brown sugar, almond milk, and vanilla extract...
3. Mix wet and dry ingredients. Fold in chocolate chips...
4. Drop spoonfuls onto baking sheets and bake for 10-12 minutes.

name: Vegan Banana Bread
description: Moist and flavorful banana bread, completely egg and dairy-free.
instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F. Mix flour, baking soda, and salt...
2. Combine almond milk and apple cider vinegar. Set aside...
3. Cream vegan butter and sugar. Add bananas, almond milk mixture, and vanilla...
4. Add dry ingredients. Pour into a loaf pan and bake for 60 minutes.

name: Vegan Blueberry Muffins
description: Deliciously light and fluffy muffins bursting with fresh blueberries.
instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 375°F. Mix flour, baking powder, and salt...
2. In another bowl, combine applesauce, sugar, almond milk, oil, and vanilla...
3. Mix wet and dry ingredients gently. Fold in blueberries...
4. Fill muffin cups and bake for 25 minutes.

name: Vegan Lemon Cake
description: A zesty and moist lemon cake with a sweet vegan glaze.
instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F. Mix flour, sugar, baking soda, and salt...
2. In another bowl, mix water, oil, lemon zest, lemon juice, vinegar, and vanilla...
3. Combine wet and dry ingredients...
4. Pour into a cake pan and bake for 35 minutes. For glaze, mix powdered sugar and lemon juice. Drizzle over cooled cake.

name: Classic French Meringue
description: Light and airy French meringue, perfect for pavlova and macarons.
instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 225°F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper...
2. Beat egg whites until foamy. Add cream of tartar...
3. Gradually add sugar and beat until stiff peaks form. Add vanilla...
4. Pipe or spoon onto the baking sheet. Bake for 1.5 to 2 hours until dry.

name: Lemon Meringue Pie
description: A tangy lemon filling topped with a fluffy meringue crown.
instructions:
1. In a saucepan, mix egg yolks, 1 1/2 cups sugar, cornstarch, water, lemon juice, and zest. Cook until thickened...
2. Pour into pie crust. Beat egg whites until foamy. Gradually add 1/4 cup sugar and beat until stiff...
3. Spread meringue over the pie, sealing the edges...
4. Bake at 350°F for 10-15 minutes until meringue is golden brown.

name: Chocolate Meringue Cookies
description: Crunchy chocolate meringue cookies with a gooey chocolate center.
instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 300°F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper...
2. Beat egg whites until soft peaks form. Gradually add sugar and beat until stiff...
3. Sift cocoa powder over the meringue. Add vanilla and fold...
4. Drop spoonfuls onto the baking sheet. Press a chocolate chip into the center of each...
5. Bake for 30-35 minutes.

name: Raspberry Pavlova
description: A delicate pavlova base topped with whipped cream and fresh raspberries.
instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 300°F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper...
2. Beat egg whites until soft peaks form. Gradually add sugar and beat until stiff...
3. Add vinegar and vanilla. Spoon onto the baking sheet, forming a circle...
4. Bake for 1 hour. Turn off the oven and let it cool inside...
5. Whip cream and spread over the pavlova. Top with fresh raspberries.

name: Classic Buttercream Frosting
description: A creamy and sweet buttercream frosting, perfect for cakes and cupcakes.
instructions:
1. In a mixing bowl, beat softened butter until creamy...
2. Gradually add powdered sugar, milk, and vanilla extract. Beat until smooth...
3. If desired, add food coloring for different colors...
4. Use immediately to frost cakes and cupcakes.

name: Chocolate Ganache
description: A rich and glossy chocolate ganache, perfect for drizzling over cakes and pastries.
instructions:
1. Heat heavy cream in a saucepan until it begins to simmer...
2. Pour hot cream over chopped chocolate and let it sit for a minute...
3. Stir until smooth. Add butter and vanilla extract, stir until combined...
4. Let it cool slightly before drizzling over desserts.

name: Royal Icing
description: A versatile royal icing that dries hard, perfect for decorating cookies and gingerbread houses.
instructions:
1. In a mixing bowl, beat egg whites until frothy...
2. Gradually add powdered sugar and lemon juice. Beat until smooth and glossy...
3. If desired, add food coloring for different colors...
4. Use for cookie and gingerbread house decoration. Allow time to dry.

name: Cream Cheese Frosting
description: A tangy and creamy cream cheese frosting, perfect for carrot cake and red velvet cake.
instructions:
1. In a mixing bowl, beat softened cream cheese and butter until creamy...
2. Gradually add powdered sugar and vanilla extract. Beat until smooth...
3. Use to frost carrot cake, red velvet cake, or other desserts...

name: Lemon Glaze
description: A zesty and tangy lemon glaze, perfect for drizzling over lemon cakes and scones.
instructions:
1. In a bowl, mix powdered sugar, fresh lemon juice, and lemon zest until smooth...
2. Drizzle over cooled lemon cakes, scones, or other desserts...

name: Spinach and Feta Stuffed Mushrooms
description: Savory mushrooms stuffed with spinach, feta cheese, and herbs.
instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 375°F. Remove mushroom stems and chop them...
2. In a skillet, heat olive oil. Sauté mushroom stems, garlic, and spinach...
3. Combine sautéed mixture with feta cheese, breadcrumbs, salt, and pepper...
4. Stuff mushroom caps and place on a baking sheet. Bake for 15-20 minutes.

name: Quiche Lorraine
description: A classic quiche with bacon, cheese, and a creamy egg filling.
instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 375°F. Place pie crust in a pie dish. Layer bacon and cheese inside...
2. In a bowl, whisk eggs, heavy cream, salt, pepper, and nutmeg...
3. Pour egg mixture into the pie crust...
4. Bake for 35-40 minutes until the quiche is set and golden brown.

name: Cheesy Garlic Breadsticks
description: Soft and cheesy garlic breadsticks, a perfect side for pasta dishes.
instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 375°F. Roll out pizza dough into a rectangle...
2. Sprinkle mozzarella cheese and minced garlic over the dough...
3. Roll up the dough and cut into breadsticks...
4. Place on a baking sheet, brush with melted butter, and sprinkle with Parmesan...
5. Bake for 15-20 minutes. Garnish with fresh parsley.

name: Cheddar and Chive Scones
description: Savory scones loaded with cheddar cheese and fresh chives.
ingredients: 1/2 cup unsalted butter, cold and cubed
instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 425°F. In a bowl, mix flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt...
2. Add cold butter and use a pastry cutter to blend until it resembles coarse crumbs...
3. Stir in cheddar cheese and chives. Add buttermilk and mix until just combined...
4. Pat dough into a circle and cut into wedges. Place on a baking sheet...
5. Bake for 12-15 minutes until golden brown.

name: Savory Herb Biscuits
description: Flaky and buttery biscuits with a blend of savory herbs.
ingredients: 1/2 cup unsalted butter, cold and cubed
1 tbsp dried mixed herbs (thyme, rosemary, oregano)
instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 425°F. In a bowl, mix flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt...
2. Add cold butter and use a pastry cutter to blend until it resembles coarse crumbs...
3. Stir in dried herbs. Add buttermilk and mix until just combined...
4. Drop spoonfuls of dough onto a baking sheet...
5. Bake for 12-15 minutes until golden brown.

name: Tomato and Basil Focaccia
description: A savory Italian bread topped with fresh tomatoes and basil.
instructions:
1. In a bowl, combine flour, yeast, sugar, and salt. Add warm water and olive oil. Knead into a dough...
2. Cover and let it rise until doubled in size...
3. Preheat oven to 375°F. Roll out dough and place on a baking sheet...
4. Top with tomato slices and fresh basil leaves...
5. Bake for 20-25 minutes until golden brown.

name: Classic Chocolate Brownies
description: Rich and fudgy chocolate brownies, a timeless favorite.
instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease and flour a baking pan...
2. In a saucepan, melt butter. Remove from heat and stir in sugar...
3. Beat in eggs and vanilla extract. Add flour, cocoa powder, and salt...
4. Stir in chocolate chips. Pour batter into the prepared pan...
5. Bake for 25-30 minutes. Let cool before cutting into squares.

name: Homemade Apple Pie
description: A classic apple pie with a flaky crust and sweet apple filling.
instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 425°F. Place one pie crust in a pie dish...
2. In a bowl, combine sliced apples, sugar, cinnamon, and nutmeg...
3. Pour apple mixture into the pie crust. Dot with butter...
4. Place the second pie crust over the filling. Trim and crimp edges...
5. Brush with beaten egg. Cut slits in the top crust...
6. Bake for 45-50 minutes until golden brown and bubbling.

name: Vanilla Panna Cotta with Berry Compote
description: Creamy vanilla panna cotta topped with a vibrant berry compote.
instructions:
1. In a saucepan, heat heavy cream and sugar until sugar dissolves. Stir in vanilla extract...
2. In a separate bowl, sprinkle gelatin over cold water. Let it bloom, then melt over low heat...
3. Combine gelatin mixture with cream mixture. Pour into serving glasses...
4. Chill in the fridge for 4 hours or until set...
5. In a saucepan, cook mixed berries, powdered sugar, and lemon zest until berries soften...
6. Spoon berry compote over panna cotta before serving.

name: Banana Split Sundae
description: A classic banana split sundae with scoops of ice cream and toppings.
instructions:
1. Place banana halves in a dish. Add scoops of vanilla ice cream...
2. Drizzle with chocolate and strawberry sauce...
3. Top with whipped cream, chopped nuts, and maraschino cherries...
4. Enjoy your classic banana split sundae!

name: Raspberry Cheesecake
description: Creamy cheesecake with a raspberry swirl and a graham cracker crust.
instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 325°F. Mix graham cracker crumbs and melted butter. Press into a springform pan...
2. In a bowl, beat cream cheese and sugar until smooth. Add eggs and vanilla...
3. Pour cream cheese mixture over crust...
4. In a blender, puree raspberries and powdered sugar. Swirl into cream cheese mixture...
5. Bake for 45-50 minutes. Let cool before refrigerating.

name: Mango Sorbet
description: Refreshing mango sorbet with a hint of lime, a perfect palate cleanser.
instructions:
1. In a blender, puree mangoes, sugar, water, lime juice, and lime zest until smooth...
2. Pour mixture into an ice cream maker and churn according to the manufacturer's instructions...
3. Transfer sorbet to a container and freeze until firm...
4. Scoop and enjoy the refreshing mango sorbet!

name: Chocolate Covered Strawberries
description: Juicy strawberries dipped in smooth chocolate, a delightful treat.
ingredients: 1 lb fresh strawberries, washed and dried
instructions:
1. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Set aside...
2. Dip each strawberry into melted semisweet chocolate. Allow excess to drip off...
3. Place dipped strawberries on the prepared baking sheet...
4. If desired, drizzle with melted white chocolate...
5. Refrigerate until chocolate is set. Enjoy your chocolate-covered strawberries!

name: Pumpkin Spice Muffins
description: Delicious muffins with the warm flavors of pumpkin spice.
instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F. Line muffin tin with paper liners...
2. In a bowl, whisk together flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, and spices...
3. In another bowl, beat butter and sugar until creamy. Add eggs one at a time...
4. Stir in pumpkin, milk, and vanilla. Gradually add dry ingredients...
5. Divide batter among muffin cups. Bake for 18-20 minutes.

name: Cranberry Orange Bread
description: A delightful bread with the tangy sweetness of cranberries and oranges.
instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease and flour a loaf pan...
2. In a bowl, combine flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt...
3. Add cranberries and orange zest. In another bowl, whisk together orange juice, eggs, melted butter, vegetable oil, and vanilla...
4. Gradually add wet mixture to dry ingredients. Pour into the prepared pan...
5. Bake for 50-60 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean.

name: Gingerbread Cookies
description: Traditional gingerbread cookies with spicy-sweet flavor.
instructions:
1. In a bowl, whisk together flour, ginger, cinnamon, cloves, and salt...
2. In another bowl, beat sugar, eggs, molasses, and vanilla until creamy...
3. Gradually add dry ingredients. Divide dough in half and wrap in plastic wrap. Chill for 2 hours...
4. Preheat oven to 350°F. Roll out dough and cut into shapes. Roll in granulated sugar...
5. Bake for 8-10 minutes. Let cool before decorating.

name: Apple Cider Donuts
description: Fluffy donuts with the essence of apple cider and fall spices.
instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease a donut pan. In a bowl, whisk together flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, and spices...
2. In another bowl, beat sugar, eggs, apple cider, buttermilk, melted butter, and vanilla until well combined...
3. Gradually add dry ingredients. Transfer batter to a piping bag...
4. Pipe into donut cavities. Bake for 12-15 minutes...
5. Let cool and enjoy your apple cider donuts!

name: Peppermint Hot Chocolate
description: Warm and comforting hot chocolate with a hint of peppermint.
instructions:
1. In a saucepan, heat milk, chocolate chips, cocoa powder, and sugar over medium heat...
2. Whisk until chocolate is melted and mixture is smooth. Stir in peppermint extract...
3. Pour into mugs and top with whipped cream and crushed candy canes...
4. Enjoy your peppermint hot chocolate!

name: Christmas Pavlova Wreath!
description: A Christmas pavlova wreath for the festive season containing your favourite berries, coulis, mint, and delicious whipped cream!
ingredients: Fresh fruit I used blackberries, pomegranate,
instructions:
Preheat your oven to 150C/130C Fan. Line a LARGE baking tray with baking parchment.
Whisk the egg whites with an stand mixer – I use my Kitchen Aid until they form stiff peaks – when you reach this stage, start adding the sugar 1tsp at a time. Once all of the sugar is incorporated it should be glossy!
One at a time, whisk in the white wine vinegar, then the cornflour, then the vanilla and whisk until smooth!
Using a small bowl in the middle of the parchment paper, dollop the mixture around it so that once you remove the bowl, it’ll be a ring shape like a wreath!
I use a tablespoon and do a large spoonful for each dollop and go round the small bowl till I have used all the mixture up. I then use a fork so spike up little bits to give it texture!
Carefully lift out the bowl and bake in the oven for 1 hour – turn off the heat of the oven and leave to cool completely in the oven, without opening the door. I bake my meringues late at night, and leave them to cool overnight to make things easier!
Prepare your fruit – chop up any fruits such as the strawberries, and clean all the berries thoroughly! Whip up the double cream with the icing sugar.
Spread/dollop/pipe the whipped up cream onto the meringue and then add the fruit on top! Add a few mint leaves for colour, and sprinkle with icing sugar! I also used a little edible glitter for a bit of Christmas cheer! Enjoy!

name: Laufabrauð – Icelandic leaf bread
description: This bread is cooked in advance, families usually meet on the first Sunday in December to make it, and it is preserved in tins until Christmas Day. It is usually served with hangikjöt (smoked sheep) or other traditional recipes from the dates.
instructions:
Sift the flour into a medium bowl, set aside.
Add the sugar together with the salt and the baking powder. Mix with the help of a spatula.
In a saucepan pour the milk together with the water and the butter. Place at medium heat and leave until the butter melts, but without boiling.
Remove from the heat and pour over the dry ingredients. Integrate the ingredients with the help of a spatula.
Begin to knead, amalgamate the dough with your hands.
Transfer to a clean work surface and start kneading. If, as you knead, you notice that the dough is very dry, you can add a few drops of water, but without exceeding ourselves. The dough should be slightly dry to the touch, but that allows us to manipulate it without cracking.
We will work the dough until it is homogeneous, practically smooth and the flour has been completely integrated. It will take about 5-7 minutes.
Cover with the bowl and leave to stand for 10 minutes.
Divide the dough and stretch.
Remove the film from the dough. Using a metal scraper or a sharp knife, divide the piece into 15, more or less equal, portions. While we work on each piece to stretch it, cover the rest with film to prevent it from drying out. This is very important.
Take one of the portions and stretch slightly with your fingertips.
Stretch the dough with a roller to a very thin, almost transparent thickness. We will stretch the dough very delicately to help achieve the desired diameter, this will be around 5,9-6,3 inches (15-16 cm).
Place a ring or plate on the dough and remove the excess with the help of a very sharp knife.
Take the piece and place it on a sheet of kitchen paper or waxed paper (if you have). Cover with another sheet of kitchen paper and then with a cloth.
Repeat the process with the rest of the pieces.
Decorate.
To decorate the leaf bread or laufabrauð, you use a utensil called laufabrauðsjárn. In my case I don't have it, so I used a blade. You could also use a very sharp knife.
Decorate the bread making cuts on the surface. You will appreciate this step much better in the video. We must always make pair cuts.
Once we have decorated one of the breads, place it again on a sheet of paper, cover it with another sheet and the cloth. Just like we did the first time.
Repeat the process with the rest of the breads.
Fry.
Fill a medium saucepan with enough oil to be able to fry the breads and float.
Place at medium heat and let it reach a temperature of around 345ºF (175ºC).
This step will be quite fluid, we will go fast so I advise you to leave everything prepared.
Place several pieces of kitchen paper where we can drain the bread that we are taking out and a space to be able to go stacking the breads.
Prick the surface of the bread and put a bread in the pot and fry during few seconds by each side. As it is very fine, it will be cooked immediately, the ideal is that we are left with a light golden color.
Remove from the pot, drain and place on the kitchen paper.
Quickly and with the help of kitchen paper, press the surface to flatten and remove the excess oil.
Set aside and repeat the same process with the rest of the pieces.
Store in a tin container or enjoy.

name: Almond Butter Bliss Balls
description: Friends, these little guys taste like just like slightly salty vanilla cookie dough but, with none of the processed ingredients. They don't call them "bliss balls" for nothing.
ingredients: 240 grams medjool dates around 10-12 dates, depending on their size
1 ½ cups / 150g rolled oats use gluten-free oats if needed
instructions:
Pit the dates and place them in a bowl and cover with hot to boiling water for 5 minutes. 
Place the rolled oats and a pinch of salt in a large skillet and place over low to medium heat to toast. Stirring regularly, cook for around 5 minutes or until the oatmeal is fragrant and just beginning to brown at the edges. Remove from the heat.
Strain the dates and place them in a food processor with the almond butter, toasted oats, vanilla, a ½ cup of coconut and the protein powder (if using)
Process the mixture adding 2 or 3 teaspoons of water to bring the it together. Continue processing until the dates are broken down and the mixture sticks together. 
Pop the remaining coconut in a bowl and begin rolling the snack ball mixture in to equal-sized balls (around a tablespoon each) and roll each through the coconut to coat.
Store in an airtight container in the fridge or freezer.

name: Liquorice Meringue Tops
description: Lakkrístoppar – Icelandic Christmas Meringue Cookies
ingredients: 3 egg whites (around 150 gr.) at room temp.
150 gr chocolate callets or roughly chopped.
150 gr ‘filling’ – liquorice would be the Icelandic choice, hard caramel, more chocolate!
instructions:
Combine egg whites with brown sugar and whisk vigorously into stiff peaks. 
Fold in the chocolate and your ‘filling’
Using 2 teaspoons place dollops onto baking sheets
Bake at 150 c° for 20 minutes in a fan assisted oven. The fan will cheer you on.
Take’em out, try not to eat them all in one sitting. 
Eat them all in one sitting.

name: Christmas Carrot Cake
description: Christmas Carrot Cake. I have been making carrot cakes for decades now and they have always been a family favourite. Fun fact – I actually made two of my brothers their wedding cakes, they specifically requested carrot cakes.
ingredients: 3 egg whites (around 150 gr.) at room temp.
150 gr chocolate callets or roughly chopped.
150 gr ‘filling’ – liquorice would be the Icelandic choice, hard caramel, more chocolate!
instructions:
Preheat oven to 350°F
In a large bowl, mix the flour, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon, and salt.
Stir in the cranberries, walnuts, pineapple, and carrots to coat in the flour mix.
In a food processor, add the eggs, sugar and oil and blend until smooth.
Add the egg mixture to the flour mixture and mix until just combined.
Pour into a greased and floured 8” x 8” baker.
Bake for 65-75 minutes or until an inserted knife comes our clean.
Place cake on rack to cool
Icing
Add the butter into a food processor, then sift in the icing sugar, pour in the lemon juice, and add the cream cheese. Blend until smooth and creamy.
Once the cake has cooled, spread the icing.
Decorate
Decorate with rosemary sprigs and pomegranate arils.
Serve and enjoy!

name: Icelandic Layer Cake or Randalín!
description: The Icelandic Layer Cake (lagkaka) or Randalín (stripey cake) has been the most popular cake since the late 1800s. It can be either brown (with spices) or white, and depending on the cake’s color, the filling was either prune jam, rhubarb jam, or buttercream.
instructions:
Heat the oven to 180°c (use convection if you have it).
Whisk together butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
Add 1 egg and continue whisking, then add the other egg and keep on whisking until the batter is very fluffy and light in color.
Mix flour and baking soda, and add half of the mixture and half of the milk. Start the mixer and stir until the dough starts to stick together.
Add the rest of the flour, milk, and vanilla essence and mix until the batter becomes smooth.
Make sure not to mix it too well, as the cake will not rise enough and become chewy.
Put baking paper on two baking sheets and spread the batter evenly in a rectangle. You can weigh it to ensure equal amounts on both plates.
Bake both plates for about 17-18 minutes
Remove from the oven and let them cool completely. While it is cooling, you can make everything ready for jam-spreading.
Cut the cake in half on the short side; then there are four equally sized portions. Spread jam on one and lay another cake on top. Spread jam on top, and then add another layer of cake. You should end up with three layers of jam and four layers of cake (you can have more layers if you want).
Now you can trim it and cut it into smaller pieces. For example, cut each quarter three times. It is possible to freeze it.

name: Strawberry Cheesecake Puffs
description: A no-bake cheesecake filling tops strawberry jam in these light and airy cream puffs that are surprisingly easy to make at home.
ingredients: For the Cream Puff Shells (Pâte à Choux)
6 tablespoons unsalted butter, cut into 6 pieces
instructions:
For the Cream Puff Shells (Pâte à Choux):
Preheat oven to 425°. Lightly grease baking sheets or line with parchment paper. Measure flour and set aside.
Bring butter, sugar, salt, and ¾ cup water to a boil in a 3-qt. saucepan over medium-high heat, stirring occasionally. Immediately remove from heat, and quickly stir in flour mixture all at once. Return to heat and stir with a wooden spoon for 1 to 2 minutes, or until dough is smooth and forms a ball. Transfer dough to the bowl of an electric mixer, and let cool 5 minutes.
Add 3 eggs, 1 at a time, beating until mixture is smooth and glossy. Spoon dough into a pastry bag fitted with a ⅝-inch plain tip. Pipe dough onto prepared pans into 1 ½-inch rounds (1 ½ inches high). Smooth out peaks and round tops with a moistened finger.
Whisk together remaining 1 egg and 1 tsp. water. Brush tops of dough with egg mixture.
Bake at 425° for 5 minutes; reduce oven temperature to 375°, and bake 30 minutes or until puffy and golden brown. Turn oven off; let shells stand in closed oven 10 minutes. Remove from baking sheets to wire racks, and cool completely.

For the Strawberry Cheesecake Filling:
Place cream in a large bowl. Beat at medium-high speed with an electric mixer until stiff peaks form. Combine cream cheese, sugar, salt, and vanilla in a separate medium bowl. Beat until smooth. Gently fold in the whipped cream.

To Assemble the Cream Puffs:
Cut the top one-third off of each cream puff. Spoon a scoop of the strawberry jam into the bottom of the cream puff. Spoon or pipe the whipped cream mixture on top of the strawberry jam. Replace the tops. Chill until ready to serve. Dust with powdered sugar before serving.

name: Gingerbread Macarons
description: These are Gingerbread Macarons, filled with Gingerbread Buttercream! Perfect for Christmas!
ingredients: Food coloring (I used a bit of brown and dijon by americolor)
1-2 tbsp milk (only if necessary to thin out the frosting)
instructions:
Before you start, get all of the ingredients ready. Prepare a large piping bag, fitted with a large round tip. Set aside.
Line two baking sheets with parchment paper or silicone mat.
Wipe the tools such as bowls, spatulas, and silicone mats with vinegar if desired, this helps getting rid of any grease particles that might be in the tools.
Measure out all of the ingredients.
Sift the powdered sugar and almond flour, along with the cocoa powder and spices together if using. Set it aside.
Start pre-heating the oven. Pre-heat to 310ºF for 60 to 90 minutes.
Meringue: Place a bowl over a pan with barely simmering water. Add the sugar and egg white powder to the bowl if using. Whisk the sugar and egg white powder so it doesn’t clump up. Add the egg whites to the bowl and whisk until the sugar is completely melted.
Transfer the syrup to the bowl of a stand mixer. With the whisk attachment, start whisking mixture on low for about 30 seconds, then gradually start increasing speed to medium. Whisk on medium for one to two minutes, until the mixture is white and starting to become fluffy.
Raise the speed to medium or medium-high and whip for a few minutes until stiff peaks are formed.
Macaronage: Pour the sifted dry ingredients into the stiff meringue. Add the food coloring if using.
Fold gently until the batter is glossy and has a thick and flowing consistency.
Piping the shells: Transfer the batter to the piping bag and pipe circles on parchment paper or silicone mat.
Resting or not resting the shells: Let the trays sit for a while until the shells dry out before baking, if you are resting the macarons.
Baking: Bake one tray at a time for about 15 to 20 minutes.
Remove from the oven and let the macarons cool down before proceeding with the filling.

name: Christmas Trifle
description: The one thing that will elevate your Trifle from 'ok' to PHENOMENAL is making jelly with real cranberry juice instead of using artificial flavored jelly. It's no different from making instant jelly – it's just that you use fruit juice and gelatine instead of flavored jelly crystals! Make real jelly, then you can totally get away with using store-bought shortcuts for everything else – like the custard and cake.
ingredients: 1 x 450g / 14 oz Madeira cake or Pound cake store bought (Note 1)
1/3 cup orange or other fruit-flavored liquor (like Cointreau), or apple, orange, or other fruit juice (or 2 tbsp brandy)
6 cups Cranberry juice, original (ie WITH sugar added, not No Added Sugar, Note 2)
2 1/2 cups heavy / thickened cream (or pure whipping cream)
HOMEMADE THICK CUSTARD (OR 900G 1 TUB PAULS DOUBLE THICK VANILLA CUSTARD, NOTE 3):
4 egg yolks (Note 7 for using leftover whites)
instructions:
Cut cake into 2 cm / 0.8" cubes. Cover the bottom of a 3.5 L / 3.5 qt trifle dish with cake and sprinkle with liquor or juice. Optional extra: Scatter over 1/2 to 1 punnet halved strawberries (this is not in the ingredients list).

CRANBERRY JELLY:
Heat half of the cranberry juice in a saucepan over medium heat (3 cups / 750ml). Bring to a simmer, then turn off the stove.
Dissolve gelatine – Meanwhile, put the remaining room temperature cranberry juice into a very large bowl. Sprinkle gelatine all across the surface. Whisk until mostly dissolved.
Pour in the hot cranberry juice. Whisk until gelatin is fully dissolved.

JELLY LAYER 1:
Pour HALF the warm jelly liquid carefully down the side of the trifle dish so the cake pieces are submerged. Refrigerate the trifle dish uncovered for 1.5 hours until it is partly set. It needs to be set enough so you can gently place a strawberry on it and it will stay on the surface. Proceed to Custard Layer steps.
Pour the remaining warm jelly in a bowl and leave on the counter. DO NOT refrigerate.
Meanwhile, make the custard so it is ready to use (see below for how to make).

CUSTARD LAYER:
Remove trifle from the fridge. Whisk the room temperature custard to loosen. Spoon onto the jelly, smooth the surface, press against the wall of the glass to seal (stops jelly bleed so you get neat layers). Refrigerate uncovered for 1 hour until the surface has firmed up a bit – just enough to hold the jelly (jelly is soft, so custard doesn't need to be fully set).

PARTIALLY SET REMAINING JELLY:
Give the remaining jelly a good whisk then put it in the fridge at the same time to thicken a bit but not fully set. Refrigerate for 1 hour, but check at 30 minutes to ensure it isn't setting too fast. The jelly should be sloppy but spoonable, scoops up in a small mound. If it fully sets, you'll end up with a "broken glass" effect on the next jelly layer rather than a clear layer (read Note 5).

JELLY LAYER 2:
Remove trifle and jelly from the fridge. Jelly should be sloppy. Carefully spoon over jelly, smooth the surface. Scatter over 1 punnet halved strawberries (or half each raspberries and strawberries). Refrigerate for 3 hours+ (can leave in the fridge for 48 hours, until ready to assemble).

ASSEMBLING:
Cream: Beat cream, sugar, and vanilla until softly whipped.
Once the jelly is set, just before serving, top with cream, then pile over remaining berries. Dust with icing sugar.
Serve!! PS It is imperative to ensure every serving includes a bit of every layer in the trifle 😂

HOMEMADE CUSTARD:
Bring milk, ¼ cup sugar, and vanilla to a simmer in a large saucepan over medium heat. Do not boil.
In a large bowl, whisk together remaining ¼ cup sugar and yolks, then whisk in cornflour until smooth.
While whisking, carefully pour in about ½ cup of milk mixture. Once mixed in, slowly pour in remaining milk while whisking. Once incorporated and smooth, pour back into saucepan.
Return saucepan to stove over low heat. Whisk constantly until it becomes thick and custardy – this will happen quite quickly, about 45 seconds (ie it is liquidy when you start, then suddenly it thickens). Once thickened, remove immediately from heat (it will continue to thicken as it cools).
Immediately pour into a bowl and cover with cling wrap, pressing onto the surface. Leave on the counter to cool to room temp until trifle is ready to layer with custard. Makes 750ml. (Note 5)

name: Traditional British Christmas Pudding
description: One of the most traditional British Christmas recipes.
ingredients: ½ cup (113 g) good quality butter (see notes)
1 heaped cup (200 g) dark brown sugar
1 tsp mixed spice (see recipe in notes if you don't have any)
1 cup (150 g) raisins (note: I soaked my raisins in brandy, overnight)
1 small apple, peeled, cored and grated
Finely grated rind of one fresh orange (or lemon)
Juice of one fresh orange or lemon, made up to 5 oz (150 ml) with brandy or rum
instructions:
Butter the pudding bowl and line the bottom with a disc of parchment or waxed paper, and butter the paper, too.
Beat the suet/butter and sugar together until soft.
Then add the flour, eggs, and spice until mixed. Then add the remaining ingredients and mix well.
Put the mixture into the buttered bowl and flatten the top.
Cut a disc of waxed or parchment paper the size of the top, butter it and place on top of the pudding mixture.
Tear a piece of parchment paper and aluminum foil, large enough to cover the top of the bowl, and go halfway down the sides, and place the foil on top of the parchment. Create a pleat down the center so that the pudding will have space to expand when cooking.
Place the paper and foil over the pudding basin, then tie some string under the lip of the bowl, leaving extra string to tie over the top to form a handle, tying it on the opposite end. If you don't have a steamer, like me, place a trivet in a pot and fill the water so that it's halfway up the bowl and use a tight-fitting lid.
Steam for 6 hours, checking the water level once an hour or so, and topping it up.
Once you've taken the bowl out of the pot, remove the aluminum foil and waxed/parchment paper, wipe the bowl and replace with clean paper. Store in a cool place.
To serve: you can steam it for another two hours, OR simply microwave it for a few minutes until it's piping hot! Let stand for a few minutes before removing from the bowl. Place on a heatproof serving dish and douse with brandy. Carefully light the pudding (please do this in a safe area), then when the flame extinguishes, cut and serve with brandy sauce or butter, whipped cream, or custard.

name: Nigella's Sticky Toffee Pudding
description: My STP is altogether deeper and darker than the original version: it is still sweet, but the muscovado sugar and black treacle give it an almost savage intensity. It seems redolent of ginger, cloves, allspice – and yet none of these spices are used. It’s a miracle. I don’t understand it – but then, miracles are not to be questioned.
ingredients: 200g/7oz soft dried pitted dates, roughly chopped
200ml/7fl oz water from a freshly boiled kettle
75g/2½oz unsalted butter, softened, plus more for greasing
2 large free-range eggs, at room temperature
200ml/7fl oz double cream, plus more to serve
instructions:
Preheat the oven to 180C/160C Fan/Gas 4 and lightly grease your dish.
Put the chopped dates, boiling water and bicarbonate of soda into a bowl, stir and then leave for 10 minutes.
Cream the butter and black treacle together in a stand mixer until well mixed, then add the sugar and mix again, beating out any lumps. Beat in an egg and keep beating – scraping down as necessary – until completely incorporated, then do the same with the other egg. Beating more gently, add the flour and baking powder until you have a smooth, thick batter.
Using a fork, stir the soaked dates, squishing them a bit, then pour the dates and their liquid into the batter and beat gently to mix in.
Pour and scrape into your prepared dish or cake tin and bake for 30–35 minutes, or until a cake tester comes out clean.
Meanwhile, to make the sauce, melt the butter, muscovado sugar and treacle over a very low heat in a heavy-based saucepan. Once the butter’s melted, stir gently until everything else is melted too. Now stir in the cream, then turn up the heat and when it’s bubbling and hot, take it off the heat.
As soon as it’s out of the oven, prick the cooked sponge pudding all over with a cocktail stick and pour about a quarter of the warm sauce over, easing it to the edges with a spatula so that the sponge is entirely topped with a thick sticky glaze. Put a lid on the remaining sauce in the pan to keep it warm.
Leave the pudding to stand for 20–30 minutes, then take to the table, with the rest of the sauce in a jug, and cream to serve.

name: Black Forest Mini Pavlovas
description: These mini chocolate pavlovas make a perfect Christmas or summer dessert, topped with whipped cream, poached cherries and homemade syrup.
ingredients: 6 Coles Australian Free Range Egg whites
1/4 cup (60ml) cherry brandy, red wine or apple juice
instructions: Preheat oven to 100°C. Line a large baking tray with baking paper. Use an electric mixer to whisk the egg whites and cream of tartar in a clean, dry bowl until firm peaks form. Gradually add the sugar, 1 tbs at a time, whisking well after each addition. Continue whisking until the sugar completely dissolves. Add cornflour and whisk to combine. Pour over melted chocolate and gently fold the mixture twice until just marbled. Spoon 6 equal portions of mixture onto the lined tray. Bake for 1 1/4 hours or until pavlovas are dry to the touch. Turn oven off. Leave the pavlovas in the oven, with the door ajar, for 1 hour to cool completely. Meanwhile, to make the poached cherries, place the cherries, sugar, brandy, wine or apple juice, cinnamon, star anise, and vanilla in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Cook for 5 mins or until cherries are just heated through and begin to release their juices. Use a slotted spoon to transfer the cherries to a heatproof bowl. Add the cherry jam to the syrup in the saucepan and cook for 2-3 mins or until mixture thickens slightly. Remove from heat. Pour over the cherries in the bowl. Place in the fridge to chill. Use an electric mixer to whisk the cream, icing sugar, and almond essence in a bowl until soft peaks form. Place the pavlovas on serving plates. Top with the cream mixture. Spoon over the poached cherries and syrup. Serve immediately.
